byline.contributor: Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.

abstract: Filipino Pres Rodrigo Duterte announces plans to reduce American military presence in country and instead build closer relationship with China ahead of scheduled talks in Beijing; China, which is pushing for greater control in South China Sea, views existing agreement giving United States access to five military bases in Philippines as containment policy it would like to undo.

headline.print_headline: Philippines May ‘Pivot’ Away From the U.S. on China Visit This Week
headline.main: In China, Rodrigo Duterte and Philippines May ‘Pivot’ Away From U.S.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The Philippine leader’s talks in Beijing are likely to signal how far he is willing to go in building closer ties with China and reducing American military influence at home....
lead_paragraph: The Philippine leader’s talks in Beijing are likely to signal how far he is willing to go in building closer ties with China and reducing American military influence at home.
